page.title: 12Knackers yard, Newark
page.content: The knackers yard smelt horrible as we entered it, especially as it was very warm weather. The man told us that you get used to the smell after a while. In one shed were horses and cows carcases hung up. These were unfit for human consumption so they were used for dog meat & for feeding the maggots while they bred there. The fat is used to make soap. The maggot farm was right next door. There were trays full of maggots which were dyed different colours to attract different types of fish when they were used for angling. The flies which produced the maggots fed on rotten fish and sugar.
